00039 void Fatal(const char* msg, ...) {
00040   va_list ap;
00041   fprintf(stderr, "ninja: FATAL: ");
00042   va_start(ap, msg);
00043   vfprintf(stderr, msg, ap);
00044   va_end(ap);
00045   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00046   exit(1);
00047 }
00048

00052   va_start(ap, msg);
00053   vfprintf(stderr, msg, ap);
00054   va_end(ap);
00055   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00056 }

00059   va_list ap;
00060   fprintf(stderr, "ninja: error: ");
00061   va_start(ap, msg);
00062   vfprintf(stderr, msg, ap);
00063   va_end(ap);
00064   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00065 }

00067 bool CanonicalizePath(string* path, string* err) {
00068   // WARNING: this function is performance-critical; please benchmark
00069   // any changes you make to it.
00070 
00071   // We don't want to allocate memory if necessary; a previous version
00072   // of this function modified |path| as it went, which meant we
00073   // needed to keep a copy of it around for including in a potential
00074   // error message.
00075   //
00076   // Instead, we find all path components within the path, then fix
00077   // them up to eliminate "foo/.." pairs and "." components.  Finally,
00078   // we overwrite path with these new substrings (since the path only
00079   // ever gets shorter, we can just use memmove within it).
00080 
00081   const int kMaxPathComponents = 30;
00082   const char* starts[kMaxPathComponents];  // Starts of path components.
00083   int lens[kMaxPathComponents];  // Lengths of path components.
00084 
00085   int parts_count = 0;  // Number of entries in starts/lens.
00086   int slash_count = 0;  // Number of components in the original path.
00087   for (string::size_type start = 0; start < path->size(); ++start) {
00088     string::size_type end = path->find('/', start);
00089     if (end == string::npos)
00090       end = path->size();
00091     if (end == 0 || end > start) {
00092       if (parts_count == kMaxPathComponents) {
00093         *err = "can't canonicalize path '" + *path + "'; too many "
00094             "path components";
00095         return false;
00096       }
00097       starts[parts_count] = path->data() + start;
00098       lens[parts_count] = end - start;
00099       ++parts_count;
00100     }
00101     ++slash_count;
00102     start = end;
00103   }
00104 
00105   int i = 0;
00106   while (i < parts_count) {
00107     const char* start = starts[i];
00108     int len = lens[i];
00109     if (start[0] == '.') {
00110       int strip_components = 0;
00111       if (len == 1) {
00112         // "."; strip this component.
00113         strip_components = 1;
00114       } else if (len == 2 && start[1] == '.') {
00115         // ".."; strip this and the previous component.
00116         if (i == 0) {
00117           *err = "can't canonicalize path '" + *path + "' that reaches "
00118             "above its directory";
00119           return false;
00120         }
00121         strip_components = 2;
00122         --i;
00123       }
00124 
00125       if (strip_components) {
00126         // Shift arrays backwards to remove bad path components.
00127         int entries_to_move = parts_count - i - strip_components;
00128         memmove(starts + i, starts + i + strip_components,
00129                 sizeof(starts[0]) * entries_to_move);
00130         memmove(lens + i, lens + i + strip_components,
00131                 sizeof(lens[0]) * entries_to_move);
00132         parts_count -= strip_components;
00133         continue;
00134       }
00135     }
00136     ++i;
00137   }
00138 
00139   if (parts_count == slash_count)
00140     return true;  // Nothing to do.
00141 
00142   char* p = (char*)path->data();
00143   for (i = 0; i < parts_count; ++i) {
00144     if (p > path->data())
00145       *p++ = '/';
00146     int len = lens[i];
00147     memmove(p, starts[i], len);
00148     p += len;
00149   }
00150   path->resize(p - path->data());
00151 
00152   return true;
00153 }

00155 int MakeDir(const string& path) {
00156 #ifdef _WIN32
00157   return _mkdir(path.c_str());
00158 #else
00159   return mkdir(path.c_str(), 0777);
00160 #endif
00161 }
00162 
00163 int ReadFile(const string& path, string* contents, string* err) {
00164   FILE* f = fopen(path.c_str(), "r");
00165   if (!f) {
00166     err->assign(strerror(errno));
00167     return -errno;
00168   }
00169 
00170   char buf[64 << 10];
00171   size_t len;
00172   while ((len = fread(buf, 1, sizeof(buf), f)) > 0) {
00173     contents->append(buf, len);
00174   }
00175   if (ferror(f)) {
00176     err->assign(strerror(errno));  // XXX errno?
00177     contents->clear();
00178     fclose(f);
00179     return -errno;
00180   }
00181   fclose(f);
00182   return 0;
00183 }
00184 
00185 int64_t GetTimeMillis() {
00186 #ifdef _WIN32
00187   // GetTickCount64 is only available on Vista or later.
00188   return GetTickCount();
00189 #else
00190   timeval now;
00191   gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00192   return ((int64_t)now.tv_sec * 1000) + (now.tv_usec / 1000);
00193 #endif
00194 }
